meaning: a good thing that seemed bad at first
Avoid saying what you mean, usually because it is uncomfortable
Better to arrive late than not to come at all
To get something over with because it is inevitable
Doing something poorly in order to save time or money

Phrase: Get something out of your system
meaning: Do the thing you've been wanting to do so you can move on

Phrase: Give someone the benefit of the doubt
Go back to the drawing board

meaning: To not hold someone responsible for something
You have to work for what you want
Things are going well so far
The person we were just talking about showed up!

Phrase: Time flies when you're having fun
meaning: You don't notice how long something lasts when it's fun

Phrase: To get bent out of shape
We'll cross that bridge when we come to it
meaning: Let's not talk about that problem right now

Phrase: Your guess is as good as mine
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
meaning: What you have is worth more than what you might have later

Phrase: A penny saved is a penny earned
meaning: Money you save today you can spend later
Believe what people do and not what they say
To make a bad situation worse
To be mistaken, to be looking for solutions in the wrong place

Phrase: Birds of a feather flock together
meaning: People who are alike are often friends (usually used negatively)

Phrase: Bite off more than you can chew
meaning: Take on a project that you cannot finish

Phrase: By the skin of your teeth

meaning: Comparing two things that cannot be compared

Phrase: Costs an arm and a leg
Do something at the drop of a hat
meaning: Do something without having planned beforehand

Phrase: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
meaning: Treat people fairly. Also known as

Phrase: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
meaning: Don't count on something good happening until it's happened.
There's no reason to complain about something that can't be fixed

Phrase: Don't give up your day job
meaning: You're not very good at this

Phrase: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
meaning: What you're doing is too risky

Phrase: Every cloud has a silver lining
meaning: Good things come after bad things

Phrase: Get a taste of your own medicine
meaning: Get treated the way you've been treating others

Phrase: Get treated the way you've been treating others
Go on a wild goose chase
Good things come to those who wait
He has bigger fish to fry
meaning: He has bigger things to take care of than what we are talking about now

Phrase: He's a chip off the old block
meaning: The son is like the father

Phrase: Hit the nail on the head
It ain't over till the fat lady sings
It takes one to know one
meaning: You're just as bad as I am

Phrase: Kill two birds with one stone
meaning: Get two things done with a single action

Phrase: Let the cat out of the bag

meaning: On probation. If you make another mistake, there will be trouble.
To argue the opposite, just for the sake of argument

Phrase: Slow and steady wins the race
meaning: Reliability is more important than speed

Phrase: Take it with a grain of salt
The ball is in your court
The best thing since sliced bread
The devil is in the details
meaning: It looks good from a distance, but when you look closer, there are problems

Phrase: The early bird gets the worm
meaning: The first people who arrive will get the best stuff
The big issue, the problem people are avoiding

Phrase: There are other fish in the sea
meaning: It's ok to miss this opportunity. Others will arise.

Phrase: There's a method to his madness
meaning: He seems crazy but actually he's clever

Phrase: There's no such thing as a free lunch
You can't have your cake and eat it too
You can't judge a book by its cover
meaning: This person or thing may look bad, but it's good inside

Phrase: A little learning is a dangerous thing
meaning: People who don't understand something fully are dangerous
Events have momentum and build upon each other

Phrase: A stitch in time saves nine
meaning: Fix the problem now because it will get worse later
A big fuss about a small problem

Phrase: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure
meaning: You can prevent a problem with little effort. Fixing it later is harder.
Something bad is coming, but right now it's calm
Move on, this subject is over
Everyone gets a chance at least once
The better you know someone the less you like him
Have more energy after having been tired
You'll make mistakes if you rush through something

Phrase: Have your head in the clouds
He who laughs last laughs loudest
meaning: I'll get you back for what you did

Phrase: Hear something straight from the horse's mouth
meaning: Hear something from the person involved

Phrase: He's not playing with a full deck

meaning: He can't make up his mind

Phrase: It is a poor workman who blames his tools
meaning: If you can't do the job, don't blame it on others

Phrase: It is always darkest before the dawn
meaning: Things are going to get better
One person alone isn't responsible. Both people are involved.
Follow a trend, do what everyone else is doing

Phrase: Know which way the wind is blowing

meaning: Something you never forget how to do

Phrase: Like two peas in a pod
Make hay while the sun shines
meaning: Take advantage of a good situation
You're more cautious when you've been hurt before

Phrase: Out of the frying pan and into the fire
meaning: Things are going from bad to worse

Phrase: The pot calling the kettle black
meaning: Someone criticizing someone else he is just as bad

Phrase: There are clouds on the horizon
Those who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones
meaning: People who are morally questionable shouldn't criticize others
In good times and in bad times
Don't waste things and you'll always have enough
Getting a good start is important
Everything is going wrong at once

Phrase: You can catch more flies with honey than you can with vinegar
meaning: You'll get what you want by being nice

Phrase: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink
meaning: You can't force someone to make the right decision

Phrase: You can't make an omelet without breaking some eggs
meaning: There's always a cost to doing something
